text: A by-election was held in the New South Wales colonial electoral district of Monara, also called Monaro, on 17 November 1870. The by-election was triggered by the death of Daniel Egan. ==Dates== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Date !! Event |- | 16 October 1870 | Daniel Egan died. |- | 20 October | Writ of election issued by the Speaker of the Legislative Assembly. |- | 7 November 1870 | Day of nomination at Cooma |- | 17 November 1870 | Polling day |- | 30 November 1870 | Return of writ |} ==Result== Daniel Egan died. ==See also== *Electoral results for the district of Monaro *List of New South Wales state by-elections ==References== Category:New South Wales state by-elections Category:1870 elections in Australia Category:1870s in New South Wales
title: 1870 Monara colonial by-election
